synopsis.text:
Yuusaku's lavish bento box becomes the talk of the class, leaving Ryuuji feeling inadequate about his own lunch-packing abilities. Determined to outshine Yuusaku, Ryuuji becomes consumed by a relentless competition, going as far as bringing a rice cooker to school. However, when Taiga presents him with a humble yet heartfelt onigiri, Ryuuji realizes that the essence of a bento lies not in its extravagance, but in the love and care that goes into making it.

In an unaired episode, Ryuuji finds himself in an unexpected battlefield - the world of bento boxes. Kitamura's grandmother, a seasoned bento maker, unwittingly sparks a rivalry when her grandson brings her exquisite creation to school. Ryuuji, feeling outmatched, embarks on a quest to outdo her, pushing his culinary skills to the brink. Yet, in this pursuit, he learns that the true spirit of a bento is not about the taste, but the sentiment behind it.

When Yuusaku introduces an opulent bento box to the class, Ryuuji's self-esteem as a bento maker plummets. In a desperate bid to surpass Yuusaku, Ryuuji plunges into an obsessive competition, resorting to extreme measures like bringing a rice cooker to school. But it's Taiga's simple, salty onigiri that teaches him the real value of a bento: it's not about the sophistication, but the emotions invested in its preparation.
